column2: What is the main goal of physical security?
column3: Protect people

column2: Which of these is an example of a physical security control?
column3: Door access card system

column2: Why are server rooms typically locked and access-controlled?
column3: To prevent unauthorized physical access to critical equipment

column2: What is a mantrap in physical security?
column3: A small room with two interlocking doors to control entry

column2: Why is CCTV used in physical security?
column3: Monitoring and recording activities for deterrence and evidence

column2: What is tailgating in physical security?
column3: Following someone through a secure door without authorization

column2: How can tailgating be reduced?
column3: Security awareness and enforcing badge use

column2: Why should visitor access be controlled and logged?
column3: For accountability and safety

column2: What is a security badge used for?
column3: Identify and grant/restrict access to areas

column2: Which physical control helps protect against fire?
column3: Fire suppression and extinguishers

column2: Why should server racks be locked?
column3: Prevent unauthorized tampering with devices

column2: What is environmental monitoring in physical security?
column3: Tracking temperature

column2: Why are UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supplies) important?
column3: Provide temporary power to critical systems during outages

column2: Why should backup media be stored in a secure location?
column3: To protect against theft and damage

column2: Which physical security measure helps control vehicle access?
column3: Gates and barriers

column2: What is access control?
column3: Mechanism to permit or deny entry to an area or system

column2: Why is it risky to leave sensitive documents on desks?
column3: They may be viewed or stolen by unauthorized persons

column2: What is a clean desk policy?
column3: Rule requiring sensitive materials to be stored when not in use

column2: Why should lost or stolen access cards be reported immediately?
column3: To revoke access and prevent misuse

column2: Which measure helps secure laptops in public or open offices?
column3: Cable locks and secure storage

column2: Why is physical security important for information security?
column3: Physical access can bypass technical controls

column2: What is a security guard’s main role in physical security?
column3: Monitor

column2: Why are emergency exits important?
column3: Enable safe evacuation during emergencies

column2: Why must emergency exits remain unobstructed?
column3: Blocked exits can trap occupants during emergencies

column2: What is the purpose of an access control log?
column3: Record who entered and exited secure areas

column2: Why is lighting important in physical security?
column3: Well-lit areas deter intruders and improve visibility

column2: Why should server room keys be restricted?
column3: Prevent unauthorized users from entering

column2: What is the purpose of visitor badges?
column3: Identify visitors and their authorization level

column2: Why is it important to escort visitors?
column3: Ensure they do not access unauthorized areas

column2: What is the primary risk of unattended delivery packages?
column3: They may be tampered with or used to smuggle devices

column2: Why are physical inventories of assets important?
column3: Know where equipment is and detect missing items

column2: Why should doors to secure areas not be propped open?
column3: Bypasses access controls

column2: What is a badge reader?
column3: Device used to read access cards

column2: Why is physical access to backup tapes or drives sensitive?
column3: They may contain full copies of critical data

column2: What is the goal of perimeter security?
column3: Protect the outer boundary of a site or building

column2: Which of the following is a simple but effective physical security control?
column3: Locking doors and cabinets

column2: Why should garbage or recycling be checked for sensitive documents?
column3: To avoid information leakage from trash

column2: What are security zones?
column3: Areas grouped by required level of access

column2: Why should equipment disposal be controlled?
column3: Devices may contain sensitive data

column2: Why is physical security awareness training important?
column3: Staff behavior affects physical risk

column2: What is a visitor log?
column3: Record of who visited

column2: Why should staff challenge unknown persons in secure areas?
column3: To verify they are authorized to be there

column2: Why is door alarm useful?
column3: Alert when doors are forced or left open

column2: What is the purpose of a security fence?
column3: Define boundary and deter unauthorized entry

column2: Why should physical security controls be regularly tested?
column3: Ensure they function properly when needed
